title: AB 2785
content: The people of the State of California enact the following. The Legislature acknowledges the significant number of English learners and pupils with disabilities in California public schools, emphasizing the importance of accurately identifying and providing appropriate services for these students. The Legislature recognizes the need for state guidance on identifying, assessing, supporting, and reclassifying English learners receiving special education services in California, as recommended by the federal government. California, with a large population of these students, should provide educators with manuals and professional development on this topic. The Department of Education will develop a manual by July 1, 2018, to assist schools in identifying, assessing, supporting, and reclassifying English learners who may qualify for special education services and pupils with disabilities who may be classified as English learners. The manual aims to offer evidence-based practices for collaboration among educators, administrators, and parents in determining appropriate academic placements and services. The Department of Education will develop a manual by July 1, 2018, to assist schools in identifying, assessing, supporting, and reclassifying English learners who may qualify for special education services and pupils with disabilities who may be classified as English learners. The manual will review resources from various sources and consult with a stakeholder group of experts. It will provide guidance on accurately identifying and classifying English learners with disabilities, aiming to avoid overidentification and underidentification for special education services. The curr_chunk provides guidance on second language acquisition, distinguishing between language acquisition and disabilities, examples of early interventions for English learners, referral processes, assessment use, consideration of extrinsic factors in pupil identification, and developing individualized education programs for English learners. Guidance on supporting English learners with disabilities in accessing the core curriculum, placement in bilingual programs, special education exit and reclassification processes, the role of culture in identifying English learners for special education, and working with families in special education proceedings. The manual provides guidance on continuous evaluation and sharing information between special education and English learner programs, in compliance with state and federal laws. It includes features like flowcharts and checklists for ease of use by educators and will be available on the department's website. The manual provides guidance on continuous evaluation and sharing information between special education and English learner programs, in compliance with state and federal laws. It includes definitions for "English learners" and "pupils with disabilities," encompassing various classifications and needs. The department, with input from stakeholders, will develop a plan for disseminating a manual and providing professional development on its content. The plan's implementation is subject to funding in the annual Budget Act. It must be submitted to various state entities by July 1, 2018, with the intent that federal funds will support this section.
